ext_description.note: The text description for this Application Object has not been fully updated to agree with the EXPRESS.
ext_description.p: A Seating_plane is a type of included specifically for the purpose of providing a description of an interface plane. One primary usage in that purpose is synchronizing the two-dimensional and three-dimensional models of a package. The seating plane simulates a mating feature when referenced as an interface_plane. The seating plane simulates the interconnect substrate surface in the definition view of a package, where it is referenced in the role of a package_seating_plane or die_seating_plane. When represented by a three-dimensional plane the normal shall represent the mating surface. The normal vector shall be in the Z axis and shall be at the origin of the defining coordinate system for the three-dimensional case. A Seating_plane scope shall be a , or a .

ext_descriptions.ext_description: A Non_feature_shape_element is a type of that is not on the physical boundary of a . A Non_feature_shape_element may be one of aDatum_reference_frame, aDatum_system, a , a , a . A Non_feature_shape_element may be a , and may additionally be one of a , a , a . A Non_feature_shape_element may be one of a , a , a , a , an , a , a , or a . An Express representation of this type description is found in the Note below and shall be used for implementation purposes.

the associated_usage_concept is an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Non_feature_shape_element is dependent on the existence of the that specifies the Non_feature_shape_element as its . There shall be zero or more for a Non_feature_shape_element.

the element_shape is an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Non_feature_shape_element is dependent on the existence of the that specifies the Non_feature_shape_element as its . There shall be zero or more for a Non_feature_shape_element.
the scope specifies the for the Non_feature_shape_element. The scope may specify the role of a , a , a , a , or a for the Non_feature_shape_element.
If the Non_feature_shape_element is a it shall not also be a Datum_reference_frame, a Datum_system, a , a , a , a , a , a , or a .
The combination of name inherited from and scope shall be unique within a population of Non_feature_shape_element.
A Non_feature_shape_element_relationship is a type of that associates a with a from which the is derived.
the relating specifies the for the Non_feature_shape_element_relationship.
the related specifies the for the Non_feature_shape_element_relationship.
The combination of the relating_shape_element inherited from and related_shape_element inherited from shall be unique within a population of Non_feature_shape_element_relationship.

ext_description.p: A Non_feature_shape_definition is a type of . A Non_feature_shape_definition may be one of a , or aDatum_reference_frame_shape_definition, or a , or a , or a , or a , or a . A Non_feature_shape_definition may also be one of a , or a . A Non_feature_shape_definition shall be used to represent annotation information or other shape property information that is not appropriate for .
ext_description.note: Shape information that is derived from a physical shape and whose algorithmic derivation details are unavailable may be exchanged with this Application Object.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the model_shape specifies the role of the for the Non_feature_shape_definition. The model_shape need not be supplied.
the associated_element specifies the role of the for the Non_feature_shape_definition.

ext_description.p: A Reference_graphic_registration_mark is a type of that is annotation graphic included in the design model for a pcb. A set of Reference_graphic_registration_mark is used to visually indicate a reference alignment for tooling purposes. The geometric representation for a Reference_graphic_registration_mark is identical to the geometric representation of the for a product that is a tool, usually a phototool.
ext_description.note: The difference between a Reference_graphic_registration_mark and a is that the Reference_graphic_registration_mark is annotation and therefore is not to be operated on as part of the design geometric model wheras the is a real feature of the tool model and is operated on as part of the tool geometric model.

Reference_graphic_registration_marks are included for complete CAD to CAD data exchange purposes since many 2D CAD applications include geometry representing these tooling marks as part of the standard CAD file output.

ext_description.p: A Non_feature_shape_composition_relationship is a type of . A Non_feature_shape_composition_relationship is the association of a with its to create a resultant . In the case where the placement is not supplied, both Non_feature_shape_definitions are in the same geometric context.
ext_description.note: A Non_feature_shape_composition_relationship is included to support composition of Non_feature and non-physical shapes. Component_2d_location and other types of location Application Objects support composition of assembly or interconnect shapes. Usage_concept_usage_view_relationship supports composition of shapes in the usage view. The name is generic to support extensibility. Mirroring is possible by use of Cartesian_transformation_operator_2d. The use of mirroring should be carefully considered toavoid confusion in receiving systems.
ext_description.example: A Non_feature_shape_composition_relationship would be used to transform a keepout shape for a detail into an overall keepout shape. It may be that the detail shape is a .

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the resultant_feature_shape specifies one role of the for the Non_feature_shape_composition_relationship. This role name is redeclared from the shape_1 attribute inherited from .
the related_feature_shape specifies one role of the for the Feature_shape_composition_relationship. This role name is redeclared from the shape_2 attribute inherited from .
the related_feature_shape_placement specifies the role of the or of the for the Non_feature_shape_composition_relationship. The related_feature_shape_placement is optional and need not be supplied.

ext_description.p: A View_level_non_feature_shape_definition is a type of .

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the model_shape specifies the role of the for the View_level_non_feature_shape_definition.
